messages.message:
Does the BUILD_TIMESTAMP (https://platform.instabase.com/docs/platform-admin/services/env-docs-svc/#build_timestamp) env var serve any purpose? If not, I am going to remove it.
```Affected services: [apps-server webapp api-server]```
I think in the past we’ve used it to hash file names for CDN, but not sure if we’re doing that anymore
Although I guess that’s a use unrelated to those services

That env var is definitely being used in `webapp` as our legacy JS bundles (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/webapp/src/py/templates/apps/marketplace-admin/marketplace-admin.html#L15) (aka IB Classic) use `{{cache_version}}` for cache busting (as William mentioned), which is based on BUILD_TIMESTAMP (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/shared/src/py/instabase/utils/web/flask_util.py#L167).
Does it have to precisely updated with actual Service Build Timestamp at version upgrades? or a later ( ~ current) timestamp is good enough ?
Any timestamp will work, as long as it's static between deployments. If the timestamp is always updating, then the cache will continuously get busted.
I can put in some work to remove these timestamp usages and move to the new cache busting method, which will allow us to remove the BUILD_TIMESTAMP variable from webapp. Do you want to go with that?
